camel.source.endpoint.ackMode.name: camel.source.endpoint.ackMode
camel.source.endpoint.ackMode.description: AUTO = exchange gets ack'ed/nack'ed on completion. NONE = downstream process has to ack/nack explicitly One of: [AUTO] [NONE]

camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumer.name: camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumers
camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumer.description: The number of parallel streams consuming from the subscription

camel.source.endpoint.loggerId.name: camel.source.endpoint.loggerId
camel.source.endpoint.loggerId.description: Logger ID to use when a match to the parent route required

camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll
camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll.description: The max number of messages to receive from the server in a single API call

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.google-pubsub.endpoint.name: camel.component.google-pubsub.endpoint
camel.component.google-pubsub.endpoint.description: Endpoint to use with local Pub/Sub emulator.

camel.component.google-pubsub.bridgeErro.name: camel.component.google-pubsub.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.google-pubsub.bridgeErro.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.google-pubsub.basicPrope.name: camel.component.google-pubsub.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.google-pubsub.basicPrope.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.google-pubsub.publisherT.name: camel.component.google-pubsub.publisherTerminationTimeout
camel.component.google-pubsub.publisherT.description: How many milliseconds should a producer be allowed to terminate.
